entry.title: Taproot NACK
entry.summary: The email discusses the potential implementation of Taproot, which could enable Monero-like features including the ability to hide transactions. The sender expresses concern that this would harm the honesty and transparency of Bitcoin, which could ultimately lead governments to ban it. They argue that the core values of Bitcoin must remain unaltered while expanding its use cases. The email is signed by LORD HIS EXCELLENCY JAMES HRMH (& HMRH) of Hougun Manor & Glencoe & British Empire, with contact information for Willtech and other projects included. It is noted that the email does not constitute general advice and should be disregarded if misdelivered.
